intro: Glomera elegantula, commonly known as the elegant glomerate, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. It has a taproot system and forms symbiotic relationships with mycorrhizal fungi. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
